programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: Riff to the Rescue! - A Wild West Adventure
programme.desc: When Riff is asked to be captain of a baseball team, he doesnt think he can do it. But Barney gives him the courage to try, by recounting the tale of his great-great-grandfather Riffle the Wild West hero!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: Lights! Camera! Action! - A Movie Adventure
programme.desc: Melanie comes up with the perfect idea to get people to donate to Grace's food drive - put on a movie premiere in the caboose! Barney and friends pitch in to help, but they all have different ideas about what kind of movie to make. Everything they try falls apart. It's curtains for Melanie's movie until she comes up with a blockbuster idea of her own.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Thief - A Mystery Adventure
programme.desc: Detective BJ is on the case when several sports balls suddenly disappear. Determined to find the mysterious ball thief, BJ falsely accuses Riff of being the thief. BJ learns he cannot jump to conclusions and must find the whole story to see who the thief really is.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: The Magic Lamp - A Travel Adventure
programme.desc: Celebrating her birthday in the park with friends, Layla is more interested in hot dogs than her mother's Middle Eastern food. When Barney reads the story of Aladdin and the Magic Lamp, Layla is transported to a Middle Eastern marketplace where she learns different cultures have many exciting foods and customs to offer.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: The Amazing Captain Pickles - A Hero Adventure
programme.desc: Captain Pickles and Wonder Princess both wanted to be the super-est superheroes. When Captain Pickles said he could jump over the moon, everyone wanted to see. BJ knew he couldn't really jump that high, but he could jump high enough to save Emma's balloon. Everyone was proud of him, even if he couldn't jump over the moon. BJ was a hero.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: A Game for Everyone - A Sports Adventure
programme.desc: Barney comes up with the idea to have a sports day in the park. All day, they play games like soccer and hopscotch among others, all for fun. Meanwhile, Baby Bop meets a girl with special needs named Jill, as well as her mom. As Baby Bop gets to know Jill more, she encourages her to play hopscotch with the others. In the end, Baby Bop and Jill win the trophy for hopscotch and she and her mother leave.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: The kids gather at the park, talking about how hot it is and wondering what to do on such a day. Thanks to Barney's brilliant idea, what starts as a too hot afternoon turns into a totally cool day as he introduces them to the wonders of water. Excitedly, they all team up to find creative ways to stay cool and have a splashing good time together!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Even though the park feels like a second home for Barney and his friends, BJ dreams of building his very own totally awesome, completely cool house. While they eagerly wait to see it, they start talking about the different rooms a house can have. However, when BJ forgets to include a space for Baby Bop in his plans, Barney reminds him that family is what truly makes a house feel like a home.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Mr. Boyd excitedly tells Barney and the kids about the upcoming arrival of a brand-new fountain for the park! While they eagerly await the special delivery, Barney and the children make the most of their time by enjoying the park's delights. They swing on the swings, admire the beautiful flowers, and create wonderful memories together, all while looking forward to the fountain's grand entrance.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: The children gather for an exciting game of on and off, which turns into a learning adventure for Barney, Baby Bop, and their friends. They explore all the different ways things can be turned on and off, discovering new ideas along the way. Later, Barney and his friends join forces to help Baby Bop find adorable costumes for her beloved teddy bear, making it a delightful day full of play and discovery!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: In the park, Mr. Boyd is organizing a special toy drive to help children in need. When Baby Bop feels unsure about donating her toys, Barney and his friends come together to show her the joy of sharing and how it can make a difference, particularly in someone else's life.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Whitney introduces Angela to the concept of an animal shelter as she shares an adorable picture of kittens. When Miss Jo misplaces her beloved cat, Cody, she decides to place a lost cat sign in the park to notify anyone who passes by. Barney and the children eagerly join the search. Throughout the search, the kids learn all about cats and the responsibilities of pet care.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Gianna and Kami have a delightful dress-up session, followed by a charming tea party with Barney as their special guest. Meanwhile, Mario announces hed like to write his own fairy tale. In their eagerness to help Mario, the children enthusiastically act out some of their most cherished fairy tales, offering him ideas and inspiration.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: The children discuss the various ways to cool off on a hot day, especially with a nice cold drink of water or some ice cream. Throughout the day, Barney and the children learn about hot and cold, but the fun really begins when Barney turns the playground into a winter/summer wonderland!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When Sarah accidentally spills red paint into the blue paint, a mess turns into a perfectly purple day. The kids use this opportunity to explore the creation of different colors by mixing them together. Inspired by this delightful turn of events, Barney and the kids organize a surprise party for Colleen, entirely centered around her most beloved color: purple.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Excitedly recounting her recent sleepover, Beth shares the fun moments she had with her friends at night. After the kids wish to see nighttime, so Barney uses this opportunity to transform the park, and explain the differences between day and night!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Stumbling upon Mr. Boyd and Bingo repairing a player piano, Barney recognizes a wonderful chance for learning and exploration with the kids. Excitedly, the children engage in playful games, immersing themselves in the delightful sounds of real pianos and even play a few notes themselves. Through this experience, they gain great knowledge about the piano, all with the guidance and encouragement of Barney and their newfound curiosity.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Together, the kids use their creativity to create a drawing depicting Barney and themselves having a blast playing baseball. After playing a game of imaginary baseball, they bring Barney into the fun. After accidentally hurting BJ's feelings by forgetting to add him to the drawing, Barney and the children learn what it takes to be a good friend. BJ realizes he has many friends and enjoys a day playing with Barney and the children.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney and the kids explore the wonderful world of counting by playing a variety of fun games, like Barney may I? Barney and the kids help Baby Bop learn how to count to 10 by including her in games, and by taking her on a make-believe shopping trip in the caboose.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney helps Baby Bop and the children discover big and little things in the world around them. When Nick expresses his concern about being the smallest among the kids, Barney steps in to demonstrate how each person's unique size holds its own usefulness. When the group heads out to the park, they begin a creative retelling of Jack and the Beanstalk. Barney and his friends discover everyone is special, regardless of size.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When the kids find a mysterious, colorful egg in the park, Barney takes them on a trip to Kenya to try to find out what kind of animal could have laid the egg. While in Kenya, Barney and the kids meet Ayira who introduces them to many people, cultures, and animals of the country!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: A Bird of a Different Feather
programme.desc: Ben and Rusty are looking for items for superhero costumes, when Barney comes to life, wearing a tutu. Tracy comes in and explains that she needs to find a bird of paradise for a school project. Ben, unsure, tells her they're only found in Hawaii and what they look like. Barney then takes the kids to Hawaii, using his Travel Book. In Hawaii, they learn different words, how to make leis and even a hula dance. Meanwhile, Ben and Rusty search for the bird, with a few close calls (a feather and what ended up being a coconut). During the Luau, it's revealed that the Bird of Paradise is actually a flower, not a bird. Ben, believing that it was a bird earlier, is shocked to hear that and apologizes to Rusty for getting him caught up in things. In the end, it all ends up just fine.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Emma wants to paint an award-winning painting for the Art In The Park Show, but she isn't satisfied with her artwork. Barney takes her to France to learn how to paint from his friend Pierre. While there, they learn about France. And Emma learns how to paint by following her heart!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: It's Earth Day, a great time for everyone to learn how to help take care of our world, but Ben is wasting paper while BJ isn't too concerned about cutting down a tree to make room for a new playground. After a trip to the rainforest and a meeting with Mother Nature, everyone learns the importance of taking care of our world. As Earth Day comes to an end, Barney reminds us all that taking good care of our Earth is the natural thing to dofor the people we love.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney helps Baby Bop see that winter can be a wonderful time for fun. Then, when she least expects itthe snow begins to fall! Barney and his friends are decorating the caboose for Christmas when Barney decides to plan a Secret Santa game. Everyone has to buy or make a gift for the friend whose name they have drawn.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Riff decides to create a musical zoo when their zoo trip is postponed. Gathering instruments that sound like real animals, Riff gives Barney and his friends a zoo-mazing experience. Baby Bop enjoys her homemade boat but wants to ride in a big one. Barney shows her boats on the computer, while BJ and Riff prepare a surprise. When they return, a sailing ship awaits Baby Bop on the playset!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Melanie is sad because she misses her friend, Marisa who is visiting relatives in India. Barney takes her and the other kids on a trip to the magic caboose to visit pretend countries like Egypt, Tahiti, and India. Barney and the little dinosaurs enjoy an Art Festival. BJ and Riff share some musical art and Baby Bop shares a painting of a very special friendBarney!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When some of the children invite Barney to join them for a race, BJ and Baby Bop decide hell need their help. By the end of the day, everyone finds out that there are many fun ways to exercise. Baby Bop cant wait for BJ and Riff to go on their camping trip so she can have Barney and the park all to herself! But, once theyre gone, she discovers that as more time that goes by, the more she misses them!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney is snacking on pistachios...and just can't seem to stop! His friends try to help. An unexpected avalanche of pistachios convinces Barney that his friends may be right. BJ has a dream after eating too many sweets, where he eats as many sweets as he wants and ends up with a big stomachache. When he wakes up, hes happy to find out it was only a dream. When he asks for a healthy snack, his friends are happy to oblige.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When Baby Bop becomes a little bossy playing with her friends, Barney teaches her that being bossy isn't a nice way to treat your friends. Riff feels terrible when he accidentally wrecks BJs beloved scooter. BJ loved that scooter more than almost anything! Riff and Baby Bop decide to have a sale in the park to raise money to buy BJ a brand-new scooter.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop is having a hard time finding a story she hasn't heard before. Barney and the dinos decide to tell her an old story with a new twist...by singing Little Red Riding Hood! When a wheelchair-bound child is unintentionally neglected by his friends, Barney steps in to help. He reminds the others to include the child by showing them that even Barney feels excluded sometimes. In the end, everyone is included for a day of fun!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop is sad because she lost her pet caterpillar, Monty. Barney and the others try to help her find it. Baby Bop is surprised to discover Monty inside a chrysalis. Everyone is excited to find Monty now a beautiful butterfly! Rachel carelessly litters in the park then later has a dream about animals who talk. With Barney and the animals help, Rachel learns that the park is home to many. Rachel realizes the importance of nature and of keeping our earth clean!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ receives a letter from his pen pal in China revealing that his pen pal will be coming to visit. With the help of friends, BJ hurries to get the park ready. He wants it decorated so his pen pal feels right at home. BJ soon learns that his pen pal wants to see how BJ really lives. Barney has a tee-rific surprise for BJ and Baby Bop. Cousin Riff is moving to town!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ is pretending to be a great detective and a case quickly comes his way when something nibbles on one of Baby Bops healthy snacks. BJ, Barney, and Baby Bop uncover several clues along the way and soon realize the culprit is a pet rabbit. When Riff hears a mysterious sound in the park, he plays detective. Along the way, they explore the sense of sound while identifying sounds of nature and the neighborhood.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop wants everyone to play with her instead of working in their garden. They promise to play with her as soon as they finish. Baby Bop can't wait, and tries many ways to get them to come play with her now. When her friends do come to play, they have a tea party and enjoy some of the fresh things from the garden. Riff invents a Happiness Machine to try to cheer up a sad little girl. But it's her friends, not the machine, that make her happy!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Everyone loves Barney! When Ryan tries to be just like Barney, he has a hard time filling Barney's shoes. Ryan soon learns that he is special when he's just being himself! Barney's friends are having a hard time deciding what to do because everyone wants to do the same thing! Barney's Native American tale, The Chase, shows them that it's best to think for themselves and not follow the crowd.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.sub-title: The Reluctant Dragon - A Fairy Tale Adventure
programme.desc: After the kids judge a spider by its creepy looks, Barney tells them the story of The Reluctant Dragon where a shepherd became friends with a dragon, who was judged by her appearance.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop's friend Monty the butterfly passes through the park with a flock of friends on their way to Mexico. When Monty gets left behind, Barney takes everyone on a visit to Mexico to return Monty to his insect friends and family and give Baby Bop the chance to say goodbye to her butterfly friend.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney's excited to find out that Rusty's family is adopting a new baby sister from China; however, Rusty's not sure if he's going to be a good brother, and he doesn't know much about China. Barney shows Rusty and the others some info China on the computer and BJ and Baby Bop talk about siblings. Through Barney's Travel Book, Barney takes Rusty, BJ and Baby Bop on an adventure to China where he can learn more about his new sister's heritage. When they get there, the people are celebrating Chinese New Year. From lion dances and talented performers to tasty treats, making lanterns and puppet shows, the celebration never runs out of fun. By the time he returns to the park, Rusty excitedly meets his new baby sister, named Mei Ling, and realizes he will be the best big brother ever.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Ben is late to the park and is disappointed to realize he missed his chance at riding a real pony. He has waited his whole life for this, and now it looks as if hes missed his opportunity. Luckily, Barney takes Ben to Spain where they meet Regalo, a dancing horse with Riff and Baby Bop. Ben and Barney return to the park just in time for him to ride the pony after all! Ben is thrilled to ride a horse and learned an important lesson about patience and waiting.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Emma is stuck with a school project and can't play soccer with Joshua. Having to interview her parents and get info about an interesting ancestor, she is frustrated with the assignment. Barney helps her discover that her ancestors were from Venice, Italy. Using his Travel Book, Barney takes Joshua, Emma, and Riff to Venice, Italy. He gives his friends a gondola ride as well as telling them about famous explorer Marco Polo. Barney's friend, Anna Maria tells Emma that she knew her great grandfather and takes her to his shop, where they try on masks and make some of their own. Emma learns that if she makes the mask in parts, she'll get it done. Barney reminds her of this lesson, so she will do the same for her school project.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney, Baby Bop, and BJ are helping the kids get ready for a school play. Barney tells everyone that putting on shows began in Greece. Of course, the little dinos and kids want to visit the country, so off they go! While there, they meet some friends and decide to put on a play in an amphitheatre. Barney knows a great story that originated in Greece called King Midas. By the end of the day, everyone has learned that wanting too much is not a good thing, especially BJ!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When Ben accidentally includes Kioko's prized music box from Switzerland in a cardboard box of yard sale items-the music box is sold! Kioko is sad and Ben wants to make things right, so he and Barney travel to Switzerland in search of a replacement gift. While there, they sample Swiss food, customs and games-but no music box! Luckily when Ben returns the music box is returned!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When the kids find a mysterious, colorful egg in the park, Barney takes them on a trip to Kenya to try to find out what kind of animal could have laid the egg. While in Kenya, Barney and the kids meet Ayira who introduces them to many people, cultures, and animals of the country!

programme.desc: Emma wants to paint an award-winning painting for the Art In The Park Show, but she isn't satisfied with her artwork. Barney takes her to France to learn how to paint from his friend Pierre. While there, they learn about France. And Emma learns how to paint by following her heart!

programme.desc: It's Earth Day, a great time for everyone to learn how to help take care of our world, but Ben is wasting paper while BJ isn't too concerned about cutting down a tree to make room for a new playground. After a trip to the rainforest and a meeting with Mother Nature, everyone learns the importance of taking care of our world. As Earth Day comes to an end, Barney reminds us all that taking good care of our Earth is the natural thing to dofor the people we love.

Barney and his friends are decorating the caboose for Christmas when Barney decides to plan a Secret Santa game. Everyone has to buy or make a gift for the friend whose name they have drawn.
